text: NSW Treasurer Dominic Perrottet says we need to be “mature as a nation” and look at how taxes are impeding economic growth. The NSW Liberal government has been working on proposals on national tax reform with the Victorian Labor government. “The states have an obligation to participate in reform to improve the federation, it can’t simply come from the Commonwealth only,” said Mr Perrottet. “I’m not putting a challenge to the Commonwealth, I want to work constructively with them in terms of how we can improve the system. “I want taxes to be lower here in NSW, we’ve already cut around $5 billion in taxes over the last four years but we want to have a tax mix that actually improves economic growth into the future.” Image: News Corp Australia
